programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.sub-title: Free Spirit : How Louisville is Blazing a New Bourbon Trail
programme.desc: Kate learns how to play a Germantown street game, gets up close and personal with handcrafted, hand-charred bourbon barrels, and learns to fall back in love with whiskey – and natural wine.

programme.title: Chronicle: Quip Town
programme.desc: (2024) An all-access look at the Aliquippa high school football team's journey to repeat as state champions, from training camp through the season, all while battling numerous obstacles.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: More Than A Feeling
programme.desc: Heart, soul and sauce overfloweth when Chef Linda Green (a.k.a. “The Yakamein Lady”) goes up against Chef Estrada from the House of Blues. When you’ve got two chefs who pack a plate with this much love, there are no losers.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: A festive headpiece in New Orleans, and wooden toy making in Omaha.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.sub-title: Maker Nation Challenge: Chalk Artists Battle the Elements
programme.desc: Rain and chalk artists don't mix – and three Kansas City artists will not only have to take on the clock but the weather as they compete against each other to create art inspired by jazz – but how long can the dry pavement last?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Making Time for Fun
programme.desc: Daniel Johnson juggles three jobs and is a single father to three kids. Kinga meets with Daniel in Pittsburgh, PA to help him ‘clock out’, reconnect with nature, and experience some quality “me time.”

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It! Sacramento: Breakfast for Dinner
programme.desc: Everybody loves a hearty breakfast for dinner, but will Chef Sean Rumery or Chef Collin Torres most impress the judges with their elevated spin on a classic? Find out on this egg-cellent episode of Plate It!

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the 'Burgh: Nailing It In Carnegie
programme.desc: Ed and Day get competitive over a round of golf and learn a new twist on old fashion cocktail making before heading to Apis Meadery in Carnegie.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.sub-title: Sports Town Stories: Cincinnati Athletes Defy Expectations
programme.desc: From a race car driver who walked away from a fiery crash, to a roller derby team that's passionate about making contact, Cincinnati athletes face adversity head on.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.sub-title: On The Job: Brendan Dances Down the Yellow Brick Road
programme.desc: Brendan wields the baton leading the orchestra, achieves his dream of performing with a cast of Queens, and serves up das boot with German local legends.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Two serial killers whose chilling crimes left their communities devastated.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Blindfolded Batting Cage Blunder
programme.desc: Dreams come true while visiting a long-time fan and cancer survivor on their way to Louisville. Ryan wears a blindfold during a batting cage challenge with Jimmy, and a couple living behind the batting cage receive help getting back on their feet.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It! Baltimore: Chef Showdown at the Black Tie Dinner
programme.desc: This is the formal food frenzy you don't want to miss. Chefs Tyler Johnson and Ben Lefenfeld are getting bougie for this Black Tie Dinner challenge. Whose meal will win best dressed?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Step to the Plate in Birmingham, AL
programme.desc: Whether it’s hot chicken or gas station pad thai, the Magic City offers plenty of ways to make good things disappear.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.sub-title: Local Love: Escaping the Single Life at 49
programme.desc: After being divorced for 15 years Angelina is looking for love in all the right places in Sacramento with three local bachelors. But she’s going to have her work cut out for her as she goes bowling, talks classic cars and completes an escape room.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: These days, cameras are everywhere. Those up to no good can run, but Big Brother is always watching.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: A Day of Fun for Young Heart Transplant Patient in Boston
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan surprise a little boy awaiting a heart transplant with a fun-filled afternoon at Boston Chidlren's Hospital. From video games and candy, to a hot sauce challenge, the team will put a smile on everyone's face.

programme.title: Chronicle: Slice of the 'Burgh
programme.desc: (2023) An exploration into what makes Pittsburgh’s pizza scene so special, and the impact pizza shops have on their communities.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.sub-title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.sub-title: Human Race By Runner’s World, Vol 3
programme.desc: Runner-in-Chief, Jeff Dengate, presents stories from around the country of runners using their sport for good.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: America's Goofiest Getaways
programme.desc: From stealing an ambulance after leaving a hospital to hijacking a helicopter for the sake of love, these criminals have odd motives and even odder methods of executing them.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.sub-title: America's Most Delish Midwest: 10 Old School Classics From The Midwest that Stood the Test of Time
programme.desc: Indulge in the old-school classics that have reigned in the Midwest for decades. From Wisconsin cheese curds to Kansas City's burnt ends, enjoy these unique comfort foods that are as timeless as they are tasty.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.sub-title: My Perfect Day with Woman's Day: Grandmothers Pinky-Promise to Self Care
programme.desc: Karla, a devoted mother and doting grandmother has had her fair share of obstacles from two bouts of cancer to caring for her husband and daughter. Karla embarks on a much needed day of pampering, seeking solace and self-care.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Silver Linings
programme.sub-title: Silver Linings: Not Your Grandmother's Retirement
programme.desc: Welcome to Lancaster, PA, one of the country's hottest retirement hubs. Here, seniors, from a beauty pageant queen to a 90 year-old swim champion aren’t slowing down; they’re rewriting the playbook and redefining aging in America.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.
